reviews.review_msg: Made course relevant, interesting, was fair, thorough, and a pleasant person. One can't slack on the readings because they can be complicated and involved. Participate with a positive open mind for you will enjoy the class and comprehend the info. Great prof. it has was a pleasure to participate in her class!
Helpful and kind professor with a lot of knowledge and few pretensions. However, she lacks clarity, at times, in lecture and is too given to broad and overgeneralized definitions of rhetoric.

Daniel Dunford was more than an instructor to me. He was inspirational and life-changing. Simply put, he changed the whole way I look at the English language and  breathed new life into my writing, speaking, and thinking. Due to the grace of God and what this man taught me, I was able to graduate with a cumulative G.P.A. above 3.5. Thank you sir!

He is extremely disorganized and we are currently 3 weeks behind in class. He is also an extremely unfair marker. Tells us in the midterm to write 2-3 sentences per question and expects 1 page per topic after. He told us to write 2 pages maximum for our Ad Report and then says 4 pages is not enough.

I have taken two courses (one a 100 level). I would recommend taking a 100 level from him, but nothing above. Very disorganized, stood me up for a meeting, and very unclear about what he expected. Lectures are fairly entertaining, but I was really most very frustrated with this class.

This is the second class I've twith Coe. He's very disorganized, but in a good way. He's funny, very flexible and accommodating and willing to help you out. Definitely read his comments on papers, as it will improve your grade on your revisions and, more importantly, your writing improves. I can't wait to take another class with him!

extremely disorganized. Received  three syllabi, third one in week 4, and it's STILL error ridden. Simply rehashes notes from previous courses indiscriminately. Unhelpful, as many 'hints' reference irrelevant information, or information for other courses.
great ideas, but difficulty in conveying them
